This magical adventure features a host of colorful characters, including a princess who has sworn off love, a dubious villain, a slightly nutty Sugar Plum Fairy, a tenacious elf, a mischievous imp, and a knight who is no Prince Charming. Bring home the enchanting tale the whole family can enjoy today!']

Review Text: Such a cute movie.  So many movies have the heros fitting the stereo type of men being tall, handsome and lots of muscles, perfect hair, same for the female heros-tall, long hair, curvy, big boobs ect.  But this movie just shows that the heros are sometimes average and sometimes what some would call ugly.  And the villian turns out to be one of the 'so-called' perfect men.
Review Title: perfect hair, same for the female heros-tall
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: The BeastMaster
Review Date: 2019/02/15
Store: Marc Singer  (Actor),     Rip Torn  (Actor),     Don Coscarelli  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, Genre for Featured Categories, Action & Adventure
Product Description: ["Import DVD NTSC/Region 0 pressing. 1982 film starring Marc Singer, Tanya Roberts, Rip Torn, John Amos and Joshua Milrad. The Beastmaster tells the story of Dar (Marc Singer), the royal son of a king named Zed (Rod Loomis) who was stolen from the womb of Zed's queen (Vanna Bonta) by a witch under the command of vicious high-priest sorcerer Maax (Rip Torn). a poor villager saves Dar from being sacrificed and raises him as his own son, teaching Dar how to fight and witnessing the boy's ability to telepathically communicate with animals. Their happiness is destroyed when their village is attacked by the evil Jun horde, a race of fanatic beast-like warriors controlled by Maax. Dar, the only survivor of the attack, vows revenge and journeys to his father's former kingdom to destroy Maax."]
Average Rating: 4.6
Product Details: {'Genre': 'Action & Adventure', 'Format': 'Color, Import, NTSC', 'Contributor': 'Rip Torn, Marc Singer, Don Coscarelli', 'Language': 'English (Dolby Digital 5.1), Unqualified (Dolby Digital 5.1), English (Dolby Digital 2.0 Mono), English (DTS 6.1)', 'Runtime': '1 hour and 58 minutes', 'Aspect Ratio': '1.85:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'Product Dimensions': '7.48 x 5.31 x 0.55 inches; 0.01 Ounces', 'Item model number': '1887705', 'Director': 'Don Coscarelli', 'Media Format': 'Color, Import, NTSC', 'Run time': '1 hour and 58 minutes', 'Release date': 'August 23, 2011', 'Actors': 'Marc Singer, Rip Torn', 'Subtitles': 'English, Korean', 'Studio': 'Anchor Bay', 'Number of discs': '1'}
Review Text: I wasnt sure about this movie when my spouse talked about it.  Its an older movie-think along the lines of the first Conan the Barbarian and first Clash of the Titans.  Well-we bought it, watched it and it was actually a really good movie.  the graphics-are older but still really good for time that the movie was made.  Story line was good, acting was good.  I especially enjoyed the little ferrets in the movie.  Adorable and reminded my of the one I use to have.
Review Title: A pleasant surprize
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------

Review Text: I wasnt sure about this movie when my spouse talked about it.  Its an older movie-think along the lines of the first Conan the Barbarian and first Clash of the Titans.  Well-we bought it, watched it and it was actually a really good movie.  the graphics-are older but still really good for time that the movie was made.  Story line was good, acting was good.  I especially enjoyed the little ferrets in the movie.  Adorable and reminded my of the one I use to have.
Review Title: A pleasant surprize

    SUMMARY:
    [Final synthesis of preferences and patterns]
raw_response:
SUMMARY:
The analysis of the purchase history indicates a strong preference for family-friendly and animated films, as well as classic adventure and science fiction genres. Consistently high ratings (4.5 to 5.0) reflect a positive sentiment towards movies that emphasize relatable characters and engaging narratives, avoiding stereotypes in hero portrayals. 

Common themes show a preference for films that are light-hearted, unique, and possess moral or adventurous plotlines, appealing to the individual’s enjoyment of imaginative storytelling. This consumer also favors quality over quantity, appreciating well-constructed narratives and strong performances—especially in movies that provide a mix of entertainment and emotional resonance.

Quality preferences lean towards well-produced content with a solid storyline, evident from the enjoyment stated for both newer and older films. Price sensitivity appears moderate; the individual values bundled or complete series purchases, perceiving them as cost-effective solutions compared to buying items individually.

Overall, this consumer appears to prioritize well-crafted, engaging entertainment suitable for both themselves and family, while demonstrating an affinity for relatable character-driven stories that eschew traditional tropes in favor of uniqueness and charm.

target_interaction.title: It's just.... Eh...
target_interaction.text: I wasnt sure what to expect with this movie.  I loved the original Addams Family movie, so was hopping this animated type would be good too.  But, after 15 minutes of watching I grew bored and disappointed.  But, kept watching since I know some movies are slow starters.  By the end of the movie, I felt like I wasted my money on this dvd.  My spouse thought the movie was okay.  It had a few funny parts he liked.  But over all, we would not reccommend the movie at all.
description: Get ready to snap your fingers! The Addams Family is back in their first animated comedy about the kookiest family on the block. Funny, outlandish, and completely iconic, The Addams Family redefines what it means to be a good neighbor.Bonus Content:
Includes Blu-ray, DVD and a digital copy of The Addams Family (Digital Copy redemption code subject to expiration. See product insert for details.)
